metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
South Carolina

Unto the Worthy Gentlemen Members of the St. Andrews Club Assembled at their annual Anniversary 30th November 1769 --

The Petition of John Graham of Charles Town -- a Native of Scotland --

Most Humbly Sheweth

That your petitioner has resided in this province for a Considerable space of time, and having met with Considerable Losses by trade and Otherways [otherwise] are now reduced in his Old Age without any Employ, or Calling, Adequate to acquire even the Comforts of Life, your petitioner therefore humbly Submits his deploreable [deplorable] Circumstances into your known humanity, and your petitioner would only Crave your generous Assistance for any small Pittance in order to put your petitioner in some small way of Trafficke, in order to put your petitioner in a small Comfortable manner -- 

May it therefore please you to take your humble petitioners Case into your most Serious Consideration and be pleased to grant such relief as to you may seem meet; And your petitioner is in duty ever bound to Pray etc.

John Graham Senr. [signature of applicant]

Charles Town
29th Novem. 1769
